page.title: 07PLACES OF WORSHIP
page.content: Lydbrook area_Places of Worship.The Church of The Holy Jesus,Lydbrook Parish Church is an imposing Victorian building,built of local stone .Nearby is a modern vicarage.There is a weekly Sunday School and a Mothers Union. Various fundraising activities include attractive flower festivals.The Baptist Church in Lower Lydbrook recieves strong local support.The Pastor is also Associate Pastor at Ross_on_Wye.Weekly services,a Sunday School,and midweek prayer meetings are held,also an annual charity lunch for the third world.An unusual Iron work gallery features in the chapel.There is a small United Reform chapel at Worrall Hill.At the Reddings,above Joys Green is an old chapel which is being converted.The Baptists have started holiday clubs held at Joys Green School.
